meanings.definition: A person who openly disregards or mocks something.
meanings.sent1: The flouter laughed at the serious speech.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the flouter for disrupting the class.
meanings.sent3: The flouter's silly antics always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: She was a true flouter of rules, always finding ways to bend them.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous flouter was known for his playful teasing.

meanings.definition: To openly disregard or mock something.
meanings.sent1: Please don't flouter the rules; follow them instead.
meanings.sent2: He would often flouter authority figures just to get a reaction.
meanings.sent3: The children loved to flouter each other's attempts at hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her sarcastic remarks seemed to flouter the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The comedian would flouter societal norms in his stand-up routines.
